result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Bernhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 6 months RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Bernhardt

records.addlTxt:
from Atty Scholz requesting clarification of bond ordered re: ZCI condition of testing weekly
BTC:  Obviously ZCI cannot test due to the defenddant moving out of State.  If ZCI did not furnish him with an approved testing facility where he has relocated, he must test the day before he appears for sentencing. 4-14-2016/lkh

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No alcohol or controlled substances.  Must be tested weekly with results provided to this Court.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.    Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Motion withdrawn by defense.  Request plea/sentencing hearing.  Positive drug test -- defendant to attend AA or other self help group or bond to be amended.  Defendant will pay the bond.
BTC:  bond modified to $10,000 cash.
TAKEN INTO CUSTODY  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Doctor's report indicates that defendant is competent to proceed.
State does not contest.
Defense does not contest.
BTC:  Defendant is competent to proceed.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.
from Dr. Collins; copies forwarded to all parties.
Defendant shall be seen on 11/9/15 w/Dr. Collins

Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense raises compentency. 
BTC: Comp eval is ordered.  Competency hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
From ATTY Scholz re: Grieve Law firm has been retained by defendant.

Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense requests a two week adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Michael L Bernhardt in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
